result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie A LaFever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:    AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with SRJ or her immediate family or her residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  DOC to assess whether deft can have contact w/ anyone under 18 yoa aside from victim.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Defense counsel reports the case is settled but would like a plea/sentencing date in approx 2 weeks.  No objection by the State.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Johnson, for Atty K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Johnson states that Atty Watson had a family emergency and was unable to appear.  PLEAS set for 2/11/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the case is likely to resolve.  FPT continued to 1/21/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Atty Kristyne Watson

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Rosa Delgado
